intro: Arjona linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf arjona, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Arjona linearis is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
